title: Restricted vs. Unrestricted Rotation Training Programs for Improving STEM Spatial Ability

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: Targeting learners preparing for STEM fields at vocational training institutions, aims to improve spatial cognition skills through mobile-based microlearning in limited-device environments

learning_goals: Learners can predict the rotation direction of 3D shapes with 80% accuracy within 12 weeks.
Learners achieve an average 20% faster response time in unrestricted tasks after limited rotation training.
Learners can successfully solve over 75% of real-world job-related problems (e.g., mechanical part assembly simulations) using spatial reasoning skills in project-based assessments.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
